From: 
Sent: Friday, April 9, 2021 10:29 AM 
To: 
ATomback@mclaughlinstern.com 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: following 
up 
; Weinstein, Marc A. <marc.weinstein@hugheshubbard.com>; 
CAUTION: This email was sent by someone outside of the Firm. 
Marc and Andy, 
I'm writing to ask for one point of clarification regarding the estate's position regarding the assertion of attorney-client 
privilege. You previously conveyed to us that the estate asserted privilege with respect to devices the FBI seized from 
Jeffrey Epstein's residences in New York and the USVI in 2019. We accordingly assembled a firewall team to conduct a 
privilege review of the contents of those devices. 
The FBI is also in possession of a  computer that the Palm Beach Police Department seized from Epstein's residence in Palm 
Beach in 2005, which our office has not reviewed. Is the estate also asserting privilege with respect to devices such as this 
one that were seized in Florida in 2005? 
Thank you, 
EFTA00026910

Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
1 St. Andrew's Plaza 
New York, NY 10007 
From:

available between 10:30 and 2 p.m. on Monday. 
EFTA00026911
